Question
========

Simpson's paradox is that the direction of the *slope* that describes the relationship between the *response* and *explanatory* variables greatly changes

Answerlist
----------

* When splitting the data using a third (categorical) variable.
* By splitting the data using the explanatory variable when there is a lurking variable.
* By splitting the data using the response variable when there is a lurking variable.

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* When the data is split by a third (categorical) variable...: Correct
* By splitting the data using the explanatory variable when there is a lurking variable...: Incorrect
* By splitting the data using the response variable when there is a lurking variable...: Incorrect
